intro: Calypsodium boreale, commonly known as the Arctic sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a small, herbaceous species that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant has a low-growing habit with simple, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It is adapted to cold climates and can survive in nutrient-poor environments. Calypsodium boreale plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat and is an indicator species for arctic ecosystems.
